prompt.focus: Make sure the photodiode is aligned and the EEG recording has begun before continuing.

eventMarker.found: Hold the USB event marker in front of the camera.
eventMarker.not_found: Note: no USB event marker found.

instructions.p1: During the task, you will see a series of images which are a set of photographs that have been used by scientists around the world for over 20 years.
instructions.p2: You will be asked to rate how much you like or dislike the image. Please rate each image on a scale from -3 (Dislike Very Much) to +3 (Like Very Much). Zero (0) is neutral... meaning you have no feelings either way. It is important you rate each picture based on your initial emotional response. There are no right or wrong answers... just respond with your feelings, and rate the pictures very quickly.
instructions.fixation:
Throughout the experiment, you'll see this fixation point at the center of the screen.
Try to keep your eyes focused on the fixation point during the task.
instructions.rate: Next, you will do one practice trial. You will see the fixation point, followed by an image. Then, you will be asked to submit your rating when you’re ready.
instructions.rate_practice: Try submitting a rating of “0” by dragging the cursor to “0” and clicking to submit.
instructions.no_talking: Try not to talk or move around more than necessary, as movements affect the quality of the recordings.
instructions.instruction_end: In a few moments, the task will begin.
instructions.block_break: Take a 10 second break and continue to block 2 of 2.
instructions.camera: Make sure the camera is pointing to you and your face is within the camera area.
instructions.breathing: Halfway through the task, you will be guided through a 3 minute guided deep breathing exercise.

block.break_p1: You will now do a 3 minute guided breathing exercise before continuing to block
